intro: Wahlenbergia pumilorum, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a compact growth habit. Wahlenbergia pumilorum is often found in open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
